result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. Defendant pleas NG. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:38 pm.

2:31 PM Jeremy Eugene Ealy in Court,  Atty Travis Satorius appeared in court, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF126, 22CF134, 22CF181 (PH). Atty Satorius: all PH will be a waiver. Court reviews and questions DE. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings. Attorneys would like to set a plea on all cases.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 1:58 PM Defendant Jeremy Eugene Ealy appears in Court, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF136, 22CF134 (PH) and 22CM136 (STC). ADA Schieffer called the Officer off today. Court questions DE on counsel, he now does qualify for PD. DE states he will be going into a rehabilitation program tomorrow. Waive the time limits. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH on 22CF126 & 22CF134. ADA Schieffer would like to set the PH in 45 days or so. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:09 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

03:37 PM Defendant Jeremy Eugene Ealy in court, in custody.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeremy Eugene Ealy appeared by video means. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared via phone.   Defendant has copy of complaints.  Court reads charges and possible penalties on each case. PD needs more information for eligibilty- Defendant needs to provide. Jail to provide PD number to defendant.  Defendant waives further reading. ADA Schieffer: 22CF16 $1,000 cash bond with no contact  with the Nawti Hawg, absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns. Atty Nelson argues for signature bond- no ability to post cash bond. Court orders  $500 cash bond with no contact with the Nawti Hawg, absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol,   Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores where alcohol is the primary sales/service. Defendant demands speedy preliminary.  3:49  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
